Articles.Content:
Hello everybody!

Last week i could not resist anymore and bought KSP and i am even more amazed than from the demo several months ago. I wanted to wait for a Steamsale, but i donÃ‚Â´t regret that i payed the "full" price. I already spend a few hours in the last days in space and got as far as a safe munshot (orbit) and return. Much to learn, much to do to get the satiscation of success. I hope my questions will find answers in the forum and the pursuit of science! The science tree is a great motivation to learn and find out what to do in KSP and i wonÃ‚Â´t stop.

Welcome aboard.

May i suggest you treat yourself with some downtime and design a really terrible rocket and watch it eat itself. Sometimes i find its a good way to relax after a failed land and return attempt.
Welcome fellow Kerbonaut! I'm happy that you enjoy your KSP copy! Now you aren't restrained to only the Mun anymore, You have an entire Kerbolar system to explore! Aim for the stars my friend!
Or just launch one of your good rockets and hit spacebarspacebarspacebar right after takeoff. It's like the 4th of July!

Welcome to the community CaptainElbow

If you get stuck with anything just ask, we'll all try to help, and congrats with your return from the Mun
